snippet: After Charles K. Goodridge was shot in 2014, he was left unaided as police officers waited for an ambulance, a response that has been criticized.
abstract: Dashcam video reveals Charles K Goodridge, black man shot by off-duty deputy in Harris County, Tex, in July 2014, lay bleeding and unattended for 15 minutes while responding officers stood by without aiding him; hour long delay getting Goodridge to hospital, where he died, has added to concerns and charges of racial bias; questions have arisen not only about what led to shooting but actions of police officers in aftermath.
lead_paragraph: After Charles K. Goodridge was shot in 2014, he was left unaided as police officers waited for an ambulance, a response that has been criticized.

headline.print_headline: A Shooting, Police Inattention, Delays, Then Death
headline.main: Relatives of Black Man Shot by Off-Duty Officer in Texas Question Police Actions
